intro: Falcaria agrestis, commonly known as the creeping santolina, is a flowering plant native to southern Europe and western Asia. It is a low-growing perennial shrub that typically reaches a height of about 10–20 centimeters. The plant features small, narrow leaves and produces yellow flowers in clusters during the summer months. It thrives in well-drained soils and full sun, making it suitable for rock gardens and borders. Falcaria agrestis is also known for its aromatic properties and has been used in traditional herbal medicine.
